1.text: Then the LORD answered Job out of the whirlwind and said:

2.text: “Who is this who obscures My counsel by words without knowledge?

3.text: Now brace yourself like a man; I will question you, and you shall inform Me.

4.text: Where were you when I laid the foundations of the earth? Tell Me, if you have understanding.

5.text: Who fixed its measurements? Surely you know! Or who stretched a measuring line across it?

6.text: On what were its foundations set, or who laid its cornerstone,

7.text: while the morning stars sang together and all the sons of God shouted for joy?

8.text: Who enclosed the sea behind doors when it burst forth from the womb,

9.text: when I made the clouds its garment and thick darkness its blanket,

10.text: when I fixed its boundaries and set in place its bars and doors,

11.text: and I declared: ‘You may come this far, but no farther; here your proud waves must stop’?

12.text: In your days, have you commanded the morning or assigned the dawn its place,

13.text: that it might spread to the ends of the earth and shake the wicked out of it?

14.text: The earth takes shape like clay under a seal; its hills stand out like the folds of a garment.

15.text: Light is withheld from the wicked, and their upraised arm is broken.

16.text: Have you journeyed to the vents of the sea or walked in the trenches of the deep?

17.text: Have the gates of death been revealed to you? Have you seen the gates of the shadow of death?

18.text: Have you surveyed the extent of the earth? Tell Me, if you know all this.

19.text: Where is the way to the home of light? Do you know where darkness resides,

20.text: so you can lead it back to its border? Do you know the paths to its home?

21.text: Surely you know, for you were already born! And the number of your days is great!

22.text: Have you entered the storehouses of snow or observed the storehouses of hail,

23.text: which I hold in reserve for times of trouble, for the day of war and battle?

24.text: In which direction is the lightning dispersed, or the east wind scattered over the earth?

25.text: Who cuts a channel for the flood or clears a path for the thunderbolt,

26.text: to bring rain on a barren land, on a desert where no man lives,

27.text: to satisfy the parched wasteland and make it sprout with tender grass?

28.text: Does the rain have a father? Who has begotten the drops of dew?

29.text: From whose womb does the ice emerge? Who gives birth to the frost from heaven,

30.text: when the waters become hard as stone and the surface of the deep is frozen?

31.text: Can you bind the chains of the Pleiades or loosen the belt of Orion?

32.text: Can you bring forth the constellations in their seasons or lead out the Bear and her cubs?

33.text: Do you know the laws of the heavens? Can you set their dominion over the earth?

34.text: Can you command the clouds so that a flood of water covers you?

35.text: Can you send the lightning bolts on their way? Do they report to you, ‘Here we are’?

36.text: Who has put wisdom in the heart or given understanding to the mind?

37.text: Who has the wisdom to count the clouds? Or who can tilt the water jars of the heavens

38.text: when the dust hardens into a mass and the clods of earth stick together?

39.text: Can you hunt the prey for a lioness or satisfy the hunger of young lions

40.text: when they crouch in their dens and lie in wait in the thicket?

41.text: Who provides food for the raven when its young cry out to God as they wander about for lack of food?
